top_categories.workout_context: Lauf True Grit Gravel Epic’s extreme sandstone and slickrock terrain with mandatory dismounts and technical rock gardens demands rapid power changes — surge over obstacles, settle on smoother sections, repeat for hours.
Racing Lauf True Grit Gravel Epic isn’t just fitness — it’s pacing, fueling, and executing when conditions deteriorate. This workout practices the race itself.
Lauf True Grit Gravel Epic rewards athletes who can hold sustained power without blowing up — threshold is the engine that drives everything above Zone 2.
Over-unders train the lactate clearance you’ll need at Lauf True Grit Gravel Epic when surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding hard.
Critical power determines how long you can sustain above-threshold efforts at Lauf True Grit Gravel Epic — a higher CP means more time in the red before failure.
The G-Spot zone (88–92% FTP) is where you’ll spend the hardest sustained miles of Lauf True Grit Gravel Epic. Make this intensity feel like home.

Lauf True Grit Gravel Epic’s extreme sandstone and slickrock terrain with mandatory dismounts and technical rock gardens and competitive field demand explosive aerobic capacity — the ability to respond to surges without blowing up.
At 84 miles, Lauf True Grit Gravel Epic punishes athletes who haven’t trained their body to produce power when glycogen runs low.
Lauf True Grit Gravel Epic’s 9,000ft of climbing demands seated and standing versatility — the ability to change climbing style as gradient and fatigue dictate.

Short, violent efforts are unavoidable at Lauf True Grit Gravel Epic — climbs demanding 2-minute maximal efforts, surges to close gaps, attacks on extreme sandstone and slickrock terrain with mandatory dismounts and technical rock gardens.
Cadence efficiency makes every pedal stroke at Lauf True Grit Gravel Epic count — smooth technique reduces muscular fatigue over long distances.
Low-cadence force work builds the muscular strength for Lauf True Grit Gravel Epic’s 9,000ft of climbing — especially the grinding, low-speed ascents.

race_overlay.nutrition: Target 60–80g carbs/hour for Lauf True Grit Gravel Epic’s 84 miles. Start fueling within the first 30 minutes — early fueling prevents late-race collapse. Bonking at mile 60 is a nutrition failure, not a fitness failure.
race_overlay.altitude: Moderate altitude at Lauf True Grit Gravel Epic. Arrive 2–3 days early. Reduce intensity expectations by 5–10%. Hydrate aggressively.
race_overlay.terrain: Highly technical terrain at Lauf True Grit Gravel Epic demands practice on similar surfaces. Ride extreme sandstone and slickrock terrain with mandatory dismounts and technical rock gardens at race-day cadence weekly. Practice cornering, descending, and power delivery on unstable surfaces. Dial in tire pressure before race week — 5 PSI wrong costs you 15+ minutes over 84 miles.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on Gravel Specific, Race Simulation, and TT Threshold to prepare you for 84 miles of extreme sandstone and slickrock terrain with mandatory dismounts and technical rock gardens in Santa Clara, Utah.
